group_works.title: Looking for a game at Lake Tyers

results.title: [Viana Stern]
results.brief_description:
A U.F.O visits the Sydney Harbour Bridge; a Japanese tourist takes photos; a person meditates; people exercise and a plane flys by.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

group.title: Stamps coming to life: Anderson Creek Primary School

results.title: [Various body movements using simple apparatus]
results.brief_description: A group of British school children demonstrate body movements using various types of apparatus, eg balance beams, hoops, boxes, mats and bars. The teacher stimulates the children by making them vary their movements and using the apparatus in many different ways - each movement flowing into the next.

holdings.name: CD ROM; Archive copy - not for public screening

results.title: [Untitled]
results.brief_description:
“Untitled” is an interactive CD ROM that explores the changing view outside the window of its main character.

The use of black and white, and its simple graphic design add to the poignancy and impact of this innovative work.

“Untitled” presents a brooding, dark Beckett-like world of isolation and alienation. The characters appear disconnected from each other and dislocated from the world presented in the CD ROM.

results.title: [Untitled segment on NAIDOC day: Access News 2000]
results.creator_credit: Pip Starr, SKA TV and Campbell Manderson
results.brief_description: A look at the National Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Day of Celebration. Produced as a news story for SKA TV’s Access News, a grass-roots alternative to mainstream news and current affairs, broadcast weekly on Melbourne’s Community Television station Channel 31 since 1994.
